availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Camp Clay, Ohio, in June 1861 under Colonel James V. Guthrie (U.S.A). Mustered into United States service on June 4, 1861. Ordered to the Kanawha Valley, West Virginia, July 10, 1861. Attached to the Kanawha Brigade while in West Virginia from October 1861 to January 1862. Assigned to Charleston, West Virginia between December 4, 1861 and January 5, 1862. Colonel David E. Enyart (U.S.A.) commissioned to command unit in December 1861 following the resignation of Colonel Guthrie. Colonel Enyart commanded regiment throughout its whole enlistment. Ordered to the Department of the Cumberland on January 5, 1862. Campaigned in Northern Alabama and Middle Tennessee during summer of 1862. Assigned to Loudon, Kentucky between October 1 and 22, 1862. Assigned to Nashville, Tennessee until December 26, 1862. Involved in the Battle of Stoneâ€™s River December 30 and 31, 1862 and January 1 to 3, 1863. Involved in Tullahoma and Chickamauga Campaigns between June 24 and September 22, 1863. Involved in the Siege of Chattanooga, Tennessee between September 24 and October 27, 1863. Assigned to Bridgeport, Alabama until January 26, 1864. Assigned to Kentucky between May and June 1864. Mustered out of service on June 18, 1864.

ab.bibl: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 557. Frederick H. Dyer, A Compendium of the War of the Rebellion, Volume 1 (Des Moines: The Dyer Publishing Company, 1908), 1197-1198.
